title: Bug: Weapon always faces upward regardless of character movement direction
description:
The weapon should always be facing up, no matter what direction the character is moving. Currently if the character moves downward then the weapon points out from the bottom left or bottom right corner. The weapon should always be out of the top left or top right corner.

**Scope:**
- Applies to ALL weapon types in the game

**Clarified behavior:**
- Weapon hand matches movement direction (right hand when moving right, left hand when moving left)
- When moving up-right or right: weapon in right hand (top-right)
- When moving up-left or left: weapon in left hand (top-left)
- When moving down: maintain last horizontal direction, but weapon stays pointing UP
- When moving purely up: maintain last horizontal direction
- When standing still: maintain last horizontal direction

**Initial state:**
- At game start (before any movement): default to RIGHT hand (top-right position)
close_reason: Fixed weapon offsets to always point up. DownLeft/DownRight now use same upward offsets as UpLeft/UpRight. Changed default facing to UpRight.

title: Epic: Monster Visual Overhaul
description:
Make the monsters look like more than circles. The player character resembles a little human. Make the monsters all look somewhat distinct with unique visual characteristics.

**Design principles:**
- Monster body shapes can vary by type (not all humanoid)
- Use classic fantasy color palette:
  - Goblins: green
  - Ogres: brown/tan
  - Orcs: gray-green
  - Wyrms: red/orange
  - Snow variants: white

**Monster types to update (6 total - no other snow variants exist):**
1. Goblin - big green ears (pointing sideways), humanoid, small
2. Ogre - big club (over shoulder), humanoid, large
3. Orc - tusks/fangs (from lower jaw), humanoid
4. Wyrm - small dragon form with bat-style wings, ogre-sized
5. Snow Goblin - white palette swap of goblin
6. Yeti (replaces Snow Ogre) - hairy, white, visible claws, ogre-sized
close_reason: All monster visuals implemented: Goblin (green, big ears), Ogre (brown, stone club), Orc (gray-green, tusks), Wyrm (red/orange dragon with wings), Snow Goblin (white goblin), Yeti (white hairy with claws). SnowOgre renamed to Yeti everywhere.

title: Fix: Rebalance armor damage reduction values
description:
The armor is too strong currently. Rebalance damage reduction values.

**New values:**
- Leather: reduces damage by 1 (was 10)
- Chainmail: reduces damage by 2 (was 20)
- Platemail: reduces damage by 4 (was 30)

**Additional rules:**
- Minimum damage is always 1 - armor can never reduce damage to zero
- Every hit must deal at least 1 damage regardless of armor

**Scope:**
- This applies to PLAYER armor only
- Monsters do not have armor in this game
close_reason: Armor rebalanced: Leather=1, Chainmail=2, Platemail=4. Added minimum 1 damage rule in both calculate_damage() and player.take_damage().
